page.title: 08CONSTABLE BURTON HALL
page.content:
{ Constable Burton Hall}is owned by Mr Charles Wyvill,whose ancestors have lived there for many generations. The present house was built by John Carr of York in 1760-68;to replace an earlier Elizabethan house,and was copied from an Italian house by Paladio.
The house is approached by a double flight of steps to a pillared portico.There is a square entrance hall with matching doors,some of which are false.
In the library are about 2500 books. The earliest book there is a Latin text book printed in 1574 and the family also owns a copy of the first folio of William Shakespeare from 1700,also a copy of the Domesday Book for Yorkshire printed in 1722.
